history.content: Just one suggestion: I hear EE127 (and/or 126) is the best prep for 189. If you plan on taking 189 in the Spring, you should take ee126 or 127 in the fall. Then in the Spring taking DS100 and CS189 would be a solid combination -- you get to learn Data Science and Machine Learning simultaneously -- the material is different enough that it will really benefit to take both but still very complimentary (also in terms of workload CS189 is one of the heaviest workloads while DS100 is on the lighter side).

I'm a 2nd year declared CS major, and intend on taking CS189 next spring. I'm currently in CS170 and Prob140 (took it over EE126 because I wanted to solidify foundations in probability because I wasn't extremely confident with 70). 

I definitely want to take 61C next semester, as I want to see if I enjoy the subject enough for upper-division coursework in that area. However, I'm confused as to whether I should take it with DS100 or EE127 (I can only choose one as I also need to complete 2 CogSci courses). DS100 will offer chances to learn practical skills like Pandas, SQL etc., also covers a couple ML models, and will allow more time for recruitment, but I believe 127 will be better theoretically, as I also want to improve my linear algebra foundations.

Has anyone taken two of these courses together and what was your experience like? What would be a better course of action?
history.subject: EE127 vs. DS100 with 61C
